forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain between 3am and 4am, then a chance of rain showers between 4am and 5am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West wind around 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Rain Showers then Mostly Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers before 10am. Mostly cloudy. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 10 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As night envelops Downtown San Francisco, a layer of cloud drapes the city, hinting at the murmurs of rain that may break the stillness between the early hours of tomorrow. The air, cool and crisp, whispers of temperatures slipping to around fifty degrees, encouraging a thoughtful ensemble of layers for those venturing out. With a low west wind, gentle yet firm, it might just beckon a soft jacket—a comforting cocoon against the chill.

Tomorrow promises a continuation of this moody canvas, with rain showers likely to dance in and out before 10 a.m., accompanied by the solemn gray of cloudy skies. The high will hover near fifty-six, steadily retreating to a brisk fifty-three as the afternoon unfolds. While the forecast teeters on the edge of rain, the chance remains modest. This atmosphere, tinged with a touch of mystery, invites an exploration of cozy local cafes, where one can savor the warmth of a well-made coffee or perhaps venture into the vibrant art scene, sheltered from potential drizzles. Each corner of San Francisco breathes an energy that thrives beneath the veil of clouds, waiting for those who seek it beneath the tranquil drama of a city caught between fog and rain.
